Interpolating data

Source: vignettes/interpolate.Rmd
interpolate.Rmd

Loading the packages required to perform this action:

library("eupp")  # for downloading/processing data
## 
##     By downloading data from this dataset, you agree to the terms and conditions defined in
##     https://github.com/retostauffer/eupp/blob/main/README.md
##     If you do not agree with such terms, do not download the data.
library("sf")    # for point locations
## Linking to GEOS 3.8.0, GDAL 3.0.4, PROJ 6.3.1
library("stars") # for interpolating data (st_extract)
## Loading required package: abind

Setting up an [sf][sf] object

Step 1, set up an [sf][sf] data.frame with point locations (sf_point) which will be used for interpolation. The name is not per se required, but used to further process the data.

In this demo we are reading a CSV file from an object. This can be done in many different ways; check out the [sf][sf] package to find out more.

locations <- "name, lon, lat
Innsbruck,11.39333,47.26833
Vienna,16.37255,48.20833
Bonn,7.09981,50.73399
Reading,-0.97305,51.45416"

(locations <- st_as_sf(read.csv(text = locations), coords = c("lon", "lat")))
## Simple feature collection with 4 features and 1 field
## Geometry type: POINT
## Dimension:     XY
## Bounding box:  xmin: -0.97305 ymin: 47.26833 xmax: 16.37255 ymax: 51.45416
## CRS:           NA
##        name                  geometry
## 1 Innsbruck POINT (11.39333 47.26833)
## 2    Vienna POINT (16.37255 48.20833)
## 3      Bonn  POINT (7.09981 50.73399)
## 4   Reading POINT (-0.97305 51.45416)

Downloading EUPP data (surface analysis)

For demonstration we will download surface analysis data from the EUPP data set for one specific date. Parameters "2t" (2m above ground dry air temperature) and "cp" (convectie precipitation) for every hour of the day (step = NULL).

eupp_get_gridded() will return an object of class c("eupp_stars", "stars") (see ?eupp_stars) which provides some convenience methods to process the data while, internally, being a barebone stars object.

config <- eupp_config("analysis", "surface",
                      date = "2017-03-01",
                      parameter = "2t", cache = "_cache")
ana <- eupp_get_gridded(config)
## Warning in file.remove(tmp_file, showWarnings = FALSE): cannot remove file
## 'FALSE', reason 'No such file or directory'

Interpolating data

Given we have our c("eupp_stars", "stars") object and the c("sf", "data.frame") object (locations) we can perform interpolation using the [sf_extract()][sf] function.

The function returns a stars object which can be coerced into a data.frame.

For plotting, we will append the name of the location again.

res <- st_extract(ana, locations, bilinear = TRUE) |> as.data.frame()
## [1] "geometry" "time"
# Appending location name
res$name <- locations$name[match(res$geometry, locations$geometry)]
head(res)
##                    geometry                time      t2m      name
## 1 POINT (11.39333 47.26833) 2017-03-01 00:00:00 270.4468 Innsbruck
## 2 POINT (16.37255 48.20833) 2017-03-01 00:00:00 278.4339    Vienna
## 3  POINT (7.09981 50.73399) 2017-03-01 00:00:00 276.4398      Bonn
## 4 POINT (-0.97305 51.45416) 2017-03-01 00:00:00 279.5566   Reading
## 5 POINT (11.39333 47.26833) 2017-03-01 01:00:00 270.4977 Innsbruck
## 6 POINT (16.37255 48.20833) 2017-03-01 01:00:00 278.3573    Vienna

Plotting 

library("ggplot2")
ggplot(res) + geom_line(aes(x = time, y = t2m - 273.15, group = name, colour = name))
